1) Problems: Debilitating indecision about Chile study abroad program, presentation/social anxiety, avoidance of calculus work. 2) Solutions: Breakthrough on study abroad via budget research and sending inquiry email; creation of emoji-based crisis system (üçï=career panic); simulated practice for professor interactions with 'sounds good' technique; financial comparison strategy. 3) Response: Initial resistance ('fine/ugh') shifted to concrete action (email sent, emoji system built, math attempted). 4) Progress: Sent study abroad inquiry despite panic, created functional coping tools, practiced academic interactions, and engaged with avoided coursework after coaching.

1) Problems: Career indecision (study abroad paralysis), presentation anxiety, social avoidance at campus events, and academic interaction fears. 2) Solutions: Step-by-step exposure (researching programs), crisis communication systems (emoji codes), behavioral rehearsal (professor Q&A practice), and accountability tools (email template). 3) Student response: Initial resistance ('annoyingly persistent') shifted to engagement (sent email, created panic protocols, practiced skills). 4) Progress evidence: Completed feared action (study abroad inquiry), developed concrete coping strategies (emoji system), demonstrated behavioral change (academic Q&A framing), and established support-seeking (roommate accompaniment plan).
